G_k3drtATua-tXlSSvp7ng.text: So arrived to a mostly empty cafe.  Order was taken but when I asked for a soda response was "fountain is out of a bunch you should go check."  Placed order and it took over 30 mins for a bowl and sandwich.  When I went to check they had no clue.  Order line was very long and slow while we waited.  Maybe six people but took 20 mins.  We were not the only one.  Woman next to me got part of her order then waited 20 mins for a scrambled egg.  She asked for toast. Server said it didn't come with toast.  She offered to pay. Was told she had to stand in 20 mins long line to order and pay. Food was actually pretty good but for prices they charge not worth the terrible service.

n3PAe_5rzz0BcdpwoO5Spw.text: My fiance and I moved to Vegas 2.5 months ago, and discovered MTO Cafe quickly upon our arrival. Nestled in the beautiful Downtown Summerlin, we were thrilled to find this delicious restaurant/take-out style cafe where you don't have to wait for table service, yet get to sit back and enjoy an awesome (comfort) meal.  My fiance raves about the BLTAE (Bacon Lettuce Tomato Avocado Egg) Sandwich. It's a huge portion with a heaping side of fries and well worth it's price tag. That alone lures him back twice a month (at least).  I, myself, first indulged in the Strawberry and Spinach Salad with Gorgonzola and a Balsamic dressing. That was delicious. Next I tried the Turkey Melt, and melt in my mouth, it did. So many awesome flavors in one bite - I don't know how they do it. Everything from the dressings to the toasting of the bread is perfectly mouthwatering.   I've also tried The Bob, which was fantastic. Sometimes they include these roasted cherry tomatoes, which are difficult to chew, but taste fantastic.   As for the service, we are always always greeted with a super friendly clerk who takes the order, delivers the food, and clears the table. They are even friendly enough to make suggestions on the menu and wait patiently while I indecisively try to order. We've never gone at a time where there's a line or crowd, so I suppose dinner isn't their busiest hour. Nevertheless, we always leave stuffed and so satisfied at the delicious crafting of foods here.  Highly recommend!

leDFGgfXttZWfZYa2hUmNg.text: So glad to have an MTO Cafe approx. 10 minutes away!  Ambiance: The weather today was perfect for outdoor seating! ...But even if one chose to sit indoors, there is still plenty of natural light and they aren't blasting discourteous music (these are two factors I will always appreciate in any dining setting). The interior is trendy--that mod-retro feel with industrial accents. There are plenty of warm hues to make you feel hungry!  Service: What a friendly staff; they're always up to speed. When a customer leaves, the table is cleared within seconds. Everyone smiles--this is a good sign!  Food: You peruse the menu and order up front, are given a number and, then, you seat yourself. Orders come out of the kitchen pretty quickly and a majority of the menu items are a hit! I definitely appreciate the thought put into these flavor profiles. I recommend the KFC and the Philly. I urge everyone not to just eat the food, but to taste it.  MTO Cafe is an excellent addition to this neck of the woods.

vSSuYvaSM-YRjZoeCE8M4A.text: Man, this place was good.  Their "Kentucky Fried Chicken" was a winner!

bYQY3S1sWuhkopLcBMabrQ.text: Definitely my new go-to brunch spot and a hidden gem in Downtown Summerlin. Everyone there is so sweet and smiling. Alyson recommended me the avocado skillet and it was amazing! Love the mash browns that go with it. I would recommend going on a weekday since they get pretty busy on the weekends. Either way, great service and delicious food!

ea0QFKTfTkfumgMQECboHw.text: Disappointing - we've eaten at the Main St location many times, the food & service have always been excellent. I wish I could say the same of the Summerlin location. Our food, Yoga Pants Omelet, Denver Skillet & wheat toast, sat finished in the kitchen window so long we had to get up & ask for it to be delivered to our table... twice. The omelet was browned & overcooked for my taste. There appeared to only be 2 people working the front of the house which was 75% full. Just as we were leaving at 2:00 six more staff showed up. The food was still decent but I'll be sticking to their downtown location.

OvYkmQpHwPXU_ZmqThZVgA.text: I prefer their other location but still delicious healthy food. I have never had something I didn't like here. I enjoy the honey walnut sandwich but my sisters breakfast plate was also delicious! Nice area to walk around after and have some ice cream and shop. This was a side of Vegas I had not explored previously and I enjoyed how local it felt.

DqtpoDlDRoNRN8cvzupEWg.text: Not impressed. It definitely was not worth what you pay for it. It wasn't  terrible, but the food and smoothies were bland. I feel like I could have gone somewhere a little cheaper and gotten the same or better meal. Underwhelmed and unsatisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon pancake dippers. They cooked the bacon through before adding the pancake batter, resulting in very tough bacon. Smh.
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mto breakfast plate. Looks nice but the taste wasn&#39;t  there and the hash browns were way over cooked.

g1blV6mCUTed7faKuADJeg.text: Their food is quite good; there are lots of reviews that attest to that.  But this review is specifically about their awesome customer service.  I had ordered a salad with dressing on the side to go for my friend.  When I got back to my house and she started eating it and noticed that there seemed to be dressing all over the salad.  So I took it back to MTO Cafe (luckily, we're only about 5-7 minutes away) and upon explaining the situation to the manager, she promptly said, "I want to make this right; is it alright if I get a new salad made for you and refund you for the first one?"  I wasn't expecting the refund and was taken aback at that and she said that she felt bad that I drove home and had to drive back.  We walked over to the register where a gentleman helped me with the refund and explained to me that the salad had dressing and an aioli.  He said it was completely reasonable to expect that someone who wanted dressing on the side would also want the aioli on the side, and apologized for the mix-up.    MTO Cafe went above and beyond for us today, definitely making a great impression on me and my friend.  We'll definitely be back!

4At6JNoWd89UbvyD699YFw.text: This place is going to be (already is) busy!  Its nice to have another fast-casual option in Summerlin.    We went for "brunch".  I use quotes because MTO is one of those restaurants that has a little of everything on its all-day menu.  Ordered a waffle for the kids to share, I had the Reuben, wife had some healthy looking thing with Quinoa cakes (it looked good but I didn't pay attention to the clever name), and got the chicken pot-pie for my dad. Green juice and coffee for the wife, soft drinks for me and dad. Some friends met us so I also witnessed the falaffel, the broccoli skillet, clam chowder, onion soup, and kids pancake.  The food was very good, everybody's looked appetizing and I was glad that my dad didn't finish his pot pie because it meant I got to help him with this pretty decadent dish.  Fresh chicken pieces with the veggies in a skillet topped with fresh baked biscuits... it was delicious and probably a million calories.  My Reuben was made with "corned buffalo"... I assume that buffalo is leaner than beef, from a taste perspective it tasted like traditional corned beef.    The service was friendly and timing was fine (they apologized that it took long as they had only recently opened but it didn't feel too long to us... perhaps because we weren't in a rush and the kids weren't bouncing off the walls).   A few things of note:  - 4 entrees and 4 drinks... $76... not a bargain but not totally unreasonable in my estimation.    - They have one of those new fangled coke machines that dispenses hundred of different variations.  I like these when a restaurant is not busy, but they're a major hassle when busy as you wait for one person to select their beverage and then for the software to reset... not the restaurant's fault.  - Coffee... my wife ordered a plain black coffee, when I went to the counter to request a refill I was meant with looks of confusion.  Finally someone said we are not currently set up for complimentary refills. I replied, "fine, I'll pay for it"... after a little more scrambling on their part I went back to the register with her cup, asked for a refill, was reiterated that there was a charge for refill, now replied with annoyance in my voice "got it, charge me".  Upon paying the $3+ for an additional cup of plain coffee I said to the cashier "I grasp the idea that you don't refill premium coffees such as lattes or cappuccinos but most breakfast-y places provide complimentary refills on plain drip coffee"... He apologized and took 10% of the coffee (approx $0.30)... kind of insulting.     It was a little cold on the outside patio but the heaters helped and it was nice because we could sit there and watch the kids play on the other side of the patio.  We'll be back.

sbM_a7SJT8zdiIWZckVq2g.text: This place is super cozy, food is amazing. I had the mto breakfast and I loved it. Staff is nice and efficient.it can be a little crowded though. If you check in with yelp you get a free cookie, kudos for that. I will be back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

NnqPlDTsdzyX1PcMXY4gIQ.text: Underwhelmed. We gave MTO a try this morning while shopping for Christmas presents in Downtown Summerlin. We were in the mood to share a snack versus ordering a full meal each, so we went for the triple stack of Vegan Carrot Pancakes + Coconut and Agave Syrup. Despite how the item is worded on their menu and expecting a carrot cake version of vegan pancakes, we were served plain, flavorless, gummy pancakes topped with raw, shredded carrot, coconuts and agave syrup.  Like I said, flavorless and so odd. Who serves raw, cold carrot with warm pancakes? The textures were very strange and not at all pleasant. Plus, because the pancakes didn't taste like anything at all, all you could taste was carrot and coconut.   Won't be venturing back, but the food was quick and the staff were pleasant, for what it's worth.

ZniiMrmL_EeRGvnV6Hex6g.text: Way too overpriced!! The food was...eh...good. I had the broccoli omelette. It was ok. It came with the omelette and about 4 sprigs of lettuce. Was that a generous side portion? The omelette was $11...come on, really? It was not that serious of an omelette to get away with charging that. My daughter had the kids pancake. It was loaded with chocolate chips, powdered sugar and a red mystery gel. It was good but not for what they charged. All in I spent $30. I don't mind paying for quality OR quantity but this place was clearly neither. The atmosphere was nice and staff was nice. I will definitely not be back nor do I recommend this place. There are better spots to get food from with better portions and quality.

KONnMe0MI8XSArTPxNDRGA.text: Ventured in with my children tonight. The young woman at the counter looked less than enthusiastic about our arrival. She never greeted us, scowled at us and was quick to inform us that the kitchen closed at 7:45. It was about 7:35 when we walked in. I thanked her and we left. nskC1LwT63G_VnJYPFx8BA.text: On Feb 15. My husband and I went to MTO Cafe and ordered a pastry and a latte. 10 minutes later our pastry was brought to us hard and cooling because some parts were warm which told me it had been sitting too long. After seeing 7 other customers who came after us get their latter's over 20 minutes of waiting the guy brought my husband his latte. Don't get me wrong, the gentleman was very polite and the order taker was a sweet lady but the organization is as different as night and day between morning and afternoon. We've been to MTO Cafe a dozen times in the morning and the service has been friendly, organized, and fast. The 2 times we have gone around 4pm has been a perfect "How Not To Run A Restaurant Cafe/Kitchen" play book. Oh and incase you think I'm lying, my TICKET #25 @ 4:54pm.

D8ClSI86I4SF3rNsAN850Q.text: Oh MTO you guys never disappoint.   This is my 3rd time coming here and it's always been equally delicious. 1yXBO9yYtbbOXRj760M-OQ.text: The Chuck E Cheese of breakfast joints lives here in Summerlin. I'm new to the area and trying a number of places, some good, some bad and a rare absolutely dreadful shows up, and today we have a winner in the dreadful category. Place is busy, stand in a 15 minute line for a single order taker, never mind there are another 3 vacant order positions at the ready but I digress. Sit at a filthy table and hope it gets cleared, alas it isn't. The egg and bacon sandwich shows up on an overly sweet roll, they cater to kids after all, and complete with cold hash browns that they call mash browns. Place is about 70% full and the line to order is 10 deep but they only have 1 cashier open (they have 2 cash registers). We wait about 20 mins to get to the front of the line. The waitress walks over to the line and tells everyone that they won't be taking any more orders for a while. This is Saturday at lunch time. What??? I was there 2 years ago and service sucked. bMXMXyrtAH5xcmNRF6KIeQ.text: I was looking for a quick healthy lunch at Downtown Summerlin mall when we landed here.  The staff was super helpful and my meal was spot on: teriyaki turkey burger with a super flavorful thick patty and equally thick pineapple slice.  Nummy!

A24f8JW37azTXmvQtfEV6A.text: We drove out to Summerlin on the Fourth to watch the parade and MTO was one of the handful of restaurants open for lunch that day. We ordered some classics that were made to order with  fresh ingredients that left everyone satisfied.  The line was about 10 deep at 11:30 on the holiday but moved quickly. The menu is fairly large with both standard American breakfast and lunch fare. Our wait was about 5 minutes and after ordering through the fast casual set up and pouring our drinks, we had a seat outside where there was some shade to protect against the temperatures which were pushing into triple digits.  The food was brought out in a timely manner despite how busy it was. The tortilla was layered toward the top on my huevos rancheros which pleased me that the texture wasn't lost from the salsa and egg yolk. I also got to have half of my wife's turkey melt. With both dishes, the creamy, fresh avocado stood out the most.  Even though we were outside, an employee regularly checked on us and cleared our plates when we finished. Lunch for three was a little pricey at $42. This is a worthy stop if you're looking for standard breakfast or lunch and might not have time for a full sit down meal.

The cucumber juice for a small was overpriced at $6, was probably the best thing there we had. Left my entire steak there for them to see. Won't be stopping by here again. 0XSUx2Y1hYRMScuWs5dbgg.text: This is for management. We were playing in the playground area and two employees were smoking right by where the kids were playing. I asked them to move and they ignored me. A couple of other people chimed in asking them to move and the employees kept ignoring us. I asked them again but, they just insisted on turning their backs and ignoring us. A lady went up to them to ask them to move and one of the gentlemen blew smoke in her face. The employee also said that he was the owner of the company. I have no clue if he was or not but, it was not a good look. It upset a lot of people that they were so uncaring about the fact that children and infants were playing while the smoke was getting in all our faces. I do hope that the management and owners see this and reign in their employees.

CROTxJq1JIKsQTtVtnmgMw.text: I took my granddaughters to lunch and we ordered at 2:18 pm. We got our food at 2:53pm. My granddaughters enjoyed their food, but my macaroni and cheese. Was loose and runny. Macaroni should be thick and cheesy. I was very disappointed in the service and my food. I did not get an apology from the manager, just the waitress did apologize after I mentioned the missing food. We did get free desserts that were average. My family tries to eat once or twice a week downtown. Very disappointed!

AP6xyjiz98ycexfLnTvgCA.text: I would actually give this place below a one star!!!  What an F&$@ing rip off! Are you joking me?!?!  That burger displayed on the front page is not what they serve! They give you just meat cheese and bread.  Then I had to pay an extra 2 bucks just to get a plate of those veggies!!! That joke of a plate in the background, with shredded lettuce one slice of tomato and some shredded onion! So I paid 11.95 as you can see in the receipt for just a cheese burger, I cannot believe that all the good places go out of business and this place is still standing.  I just want to add that I spoke with the manager and he was beyond nice.  The staff obviously was very sweet and not their fault.

OEDbMlPccYjh2_S_hLNhfQ.text: I work at the mall and I ordered Huevos Rancheros on my break. I usually love MTO. The food is great and it is a nice place to eat, a little pricey for the food that they have, but I've never minded paying a little more until today. When I got my food the girl who delivered it was very sweet, but when I opened it I found that my food had literally been thrown in the box. It was good, but it was a mess. I was thoroughly disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Huevos Rancheros from MTO downtown summerlin. Literally just thrown in the box for delivery.

QiBYWNynXw2dvx9vLw7d4w.text: I ordered the Veggie hash (on the grill) and was a little disappointed with the amount of leafy greens and veggies (spinach, mushroom, tomatoes, and broccoli) in the grill.  Potatoes lacked seasoning/ flavors and the veggies were over cooked with burnt sides.    Customer service was also a 3-star rating -- Cashier went ahead and helped out another customer who was not in line before helping the people who were already in line.    Condiment bar can afford to have a carafe of half/half or other creamer options rather than the individual plastic ones - minor details.  Food was delivered in a timely manner and the environment could be good for different occasions!

y-O9y9EbFmQwQZlF9lgs2A.text: Nice little cafe inside the Downtown Summerlin mall. The food here is good with a lot of healthy options, while you're out & about. I've been here a couple times & tried their burger, sandwich & soups. Everything I've had here so far has been good. The price is decent for being in a mall location. Sometimes the cafe can get a little busy, so seating can be a hassle but overall it's a good cafe to check out.

kssMBdRBOk2yhCqg9ipBVw.text: Have been to MTO Cafe at Downtown Summerlin a few times now.   Sometimes it was good (the clam chowder) and sometimes not so much. About one week ago I decided to try the Chicken Pot Pie as it's one of their signature dishes and I had seen the reviews on Yelp.   This dish was a deal breaker in that I won't be returning to this place ever again.   Presentation is cute, comes in a little skillet with biscuits. The chicken was flavorless and tough. I had to add a ton of salt just to have some sort of seasoning. The biscuits were so hard I had to use a knife to cut through them (think hockey puck) and then the taste was like cardboard (think cardboard). As I'm trying to navigate some flavor out of this dish, I happen upon a chicken bone, and I mean a large bone.   The waitress comes over, asks how the meal is, so I point to the bone and tell her (nicely) I don't think I would order this again and give her the particulars as stated earlier. She was nice and apologetic but nothing more. No manager was asked to come, she just trotted off like, "oh well, thanks for coming in", and left me.   So here I am staring down at my chicken bone, served with dried out hockey puck biscuits covering a tasteless goo of tough chicken and wondering, why I was paying $15 for this meal?  There are waaay to many options in this town to get great food so I'll be checking MTO off my list as one.

24hoKiQ1fmOZOmGOKBJSUg.text: Best place to go to when you want that breakfast in my pictures I'm showing the MTO breakfast and my 1st time trying chicken and waffles ... 1st bite is unbelievable ... Young Lee is the man!

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MTO breakfast in the back the best chicken and waffles in the world in the front ... A billion times better than roscoes

mMYKcVSurzXNq7y9O1RtMg.text: Myself and 3 other employees spent $64 and some change this morning ordering the worst breakfast we've ever had. I wasn't going to make a review and I tried to handle it before letting the world know about my experience. For starters after RETURNING 1 of the 4 meals we received the lady who also took my order had a complete attitude. After walking back to my job and calling trying to find out the supervisor or managers name she refused to give it to me by stating" she doesnt know anyones first names" smh. Im so disappointed on how they handled the mistakes of there service and refused to fix my problems. Everything was thrown on top of eachother in Togo boxes NOT PLATES. Everything was touching. The sausage was suppose to be well done and was damn near raw, they BURNT everyones bacon. The FRENCH TOAST was extrwmely soggy. I would never spend my money here ever again. So unprofessional and they dont seem to own up to any of the mistakes they have made on our $64.64 order. We threw everything in the trash and had to spend more money somewhere else. This is unbelievable how they wouldn't give me there managers or corporates information.   Receipt Number: xl9h Ticket number: 97 came in on July 25th @ 11:26Am

OdZwbiaKTIgy9RAJSkFLxg.text: The food was amazing, the people were fun, and the environment was good. Thanks for the great breakfast. Noel is awesome.

nGroMCaUm2Ye0NmqUL79aA.text: I went here over a week ago.  I am still dreaming about my return to have the Hangover Burger once again.   It is TDF.  This is a two handed burger that is indulgently mess...juices running down your arm, about a dozen napkins needed. The egg was perfectly cooked...oozy warm yolk, medium burger cooked medium (yeah!), good sturdy but soft bun (which I don't eat, but gives structure), I believe quality Tillamook Cheddar for a little tang and more unchousness? (sp).    Just me...I wish service wasn't so cafeteria like but they still bring it too you!  Great place...I will return!

YYchIc93J2GsjF06AhJSug.text: So, my husband, daughter and I escaped out last Saturday evening for a quick bite to eat at Downtown Summerlin.  I had seen some great things about MTO Cafe on Yelp and through Instagram and suggested we give it a try as we were going for something quick and easy.  We each ordered a salad and split a side of fries(I know kind of an oxymoron, but this was concidered a cheat meal).  We decided to sit on the patio, as I always love the option to do so.  We made our way out and had a seat.  Not long after a gentleman with a very large dog seated himself behind us.  No qualms by us about the dog, but that's what initially drew my attention to the fact that we weren't lone soldiers on the patio.  We received our food, which was great(review not 100% on that).  It was from that point that I began to listen to the gentleman behind us begin to boss the friendly cashier around as to his demands of his order.  Then, something was not up to par on his order and he called for the manager on duty that evening.  He came out, also a seemingly nice young man, and he too got an earful from this guy.    Now, never at any time, would I say this guy was yelling; but I repeatedly kept mouthing to my husband how rude this guy was behind us.  When we got up to leave, I was so curious to know about this guy as at this point I thought he couldn't have just been some customer off the street; he had to have an affiliation.  So, I walked back inside to ask the initial friendly cashier; and come to find out, he was a partner in the restaurant!   Mr. Matt Moore, if you are reading this, it is one thing to ensure the food that is coming our of your kitchen is prepared well; I can appreciate that immensely, but it's another to demean your employees on your restaurant's patio, especially when there are customers within earshot.  I definitely see you have a lot of experience in the design and construction industry.  And, I also see you served for us; THANK YOU for that.  However, may I make a small recommendation:  Customer Service.  You built this business for a reason and are a part of it's face.  When you are part of its face, I would imagine you most certainly wouldn't want customers thinking that face is full of belittlement or superiority, but rather support and collaboration.  YOU are part of YOUR brand....

sFFazkz6ZTWJiU7EtLJ61A.text: MTO was so incredible. We got the fat Elvis, chicken and waffle, wings, blue burger, and the Mac and cheese. The establishment is so cute it's like a order and sit down restaurant like a Panera bread style. The food is soooooo good and huge portions for the price. It was only 60$ for all of our amazing food. I will be back!!! The staff were very helpful and friendly.

hbELfOAG21XWqOSBd3Jk6Q.text: Overpriced for fast causal mediocre food. Maybe I bought the wrong thing (MTO breakfast) but it was pretty basic eggs, potatoes, some protein. Very bland, under-seasoned.  $14 add a drink so about $20 after all said and done. That's not worth it IMO. At least the interior design and location is nice w/ Indoor and outdoor seating. Which is why it earns 3 stars instead of 2. TBH I'd rather go elsewhere than support their high overhead costs. I haven't been back their since. If a place wants to charge $14 I want full service and the food needs to not be bland.

xyYYTFX6_pqylMJ1jrbFkA.text: Service was super friendly from the cashier to the expo to all the members who checked on us! Great outdoor atmosphere and food was SO yummy!! Can't wait to check out the rest of their dishes!

nJdGjXREhjOdsVOXNvh7-A.text: I'm not one to complain about prices when the quality is in line with what is charged, however mto at Downtown Summerlin is outright ridiculous.  I went in for a smoothie and was amazed by a $9 price tag for a Creamsicle smoothie, but thought it must taste amazing for $9!!! It was terrible. Nothing but orange juice and vanilla soy.   Horrible and $9 down the drain. Staff seemed very young and inexperienced as well. Buyer beware!

niVj9DDpBS1VVi9EFIX_zw.text: Regretting leaving the tip at the register before getting the food and service.  When I asked the food service girl for a comment card for feedback, she suggested Yelp.  Well, Missy, I not here to compliment you.  Based on the poor reviews here that go back to it's opening, you'd think management would correct the customer service issues.  Apparently not.  I also found the food overpriced, and customer service lacking.  They seem to expect a 15-20% tip for food you order at the counter, then when seated, I asked the server for a fork, she points us to a service stand?  WTF.  I understand why this place was pretty quiet at lunch today.

60mgNEbXBGmKR1mZ9SIqcQ.text: I decided to come to MTO cafe to have some brunch with my boyfriend. I wanted to try this place because the food looked really good. I got the chorizo skillet and clam chowder. I LOVE clam chowder so how could I not order it. My boyfriend ordered the hero. When we got our food, everything seemed to look delicious. But I was wrong. The "chorizo" skillet didn't even have chorizo in it. My boyfriend is Mexican I would know. The whole thing was bland. It was just so disappointing. Well on to the clam chowder, it actually has some decent flavor and seasoning. It had lots of chunks of clams which is a big plus. Usually places are not that generous with their clams. Lastly, my boyfriend's sandwich was just average. Nothing special. Overall MTO cafe is just meh. Nothing to it.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks can be deceiving.

eyN-Ahp4yJWZmn7Ce_oIUQ.text: This is a good place for a lunch or late breakfast before a day of shopping. I really like their chicken skillet with egg whites. It's pretty healthy and really flavorful. The service is always friendly when they take your order and the food comes out pretty quickly even when they're busy.

vJECCBmcb19Q7PjcqM6YZA.text: Service was the worst part of this visit! The menu seems really good and tasty but if they can't get your order right and they don't serve everyone at the table at the same time it kills your lunch experience. My mother's order was the worst. She ordered the teriyaki steak bowl. The bowl came out about 10 minutes after the rest of the orders first of all. Secondly, she ended up only eating the steak because the rice was swimming, literally swimming in teriyaki sauce. It was like teriyaki soup with rice. My mom not wanting to complain too much didn't mention it to me until we were all done and she had finished most of the steak. So she went to the counter just to tell them hat they messed up the order, not asking for anything in return but just to make them aware of the type of dishes they are serving. My husband had ordered fries with his sandwich and was given a salad. They made that up by giving him a side of fries but the fries he was given looked like the bottom of the fryer fries, all scrape pieces and over cooked. My salad was ok but my chicken didn't seem to be grilled more like defrosted chicken and now that I think of it, I'm not sure if the dressing was on there or not. Anyways, we won't be back and I just hope they work out their quality control.

M6kVCvqgNWZFAFsNdU5G-A.text: Food is great but the service is amazing from the moment you get on the door a welcoming hello and smiling faces!!!

L_bv4V92TVlw6bg2wpN6aA.text: Their food is amazing !!!!! I got the French toast & my boyfriend got the Kentucky fried chicken. Both were so good. This might be our new fave breakfast spot now :) & the atmosphere is so mellow & calm & the staff seemed pretty nice & we didn't have to wait too long for our food , we are here on a Sunday & it's not even packed which is more than perfect !

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing ! French toast &amp; Kentucky fried chicken.

FTfQdEl0eA-veBgxy8fsUA.text: Very dissappinted in service. My boyfriend and I are vegan and specifically came here because another vegan told us of their great experience. I saw that some items on the menu could be made vegan upon request. I ordered the tomato basil soup which came with a grilled cheese - all vegan. We also ordered a falafel sandwich. When the soup and grilled cheese arrived, the grilled cheese looked a little suspicious. I asked if it was vegan, and the woman said no, they don't have vegan cheese. They had no answer when we asked why a non-vegan side would come with a vegan item on the menu. Instead of rectifying their own mistake, we were offered two toothpicks with three small pieces of fruit. The manager said that's "the best" he could do.   We will not return and do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

d2kbIhNe0smyn87tP72gOw.text: One of my friends wanted to do breakfast brunch on a Saturday morning and we decided to stop by MTO Cafe, located inside Downtown Summerlin.  MTO Cafe is right next to several other restaurants such as CPK and Maggianos. MTO Cafe has inside seating and outside seating. We decided to sit outside.   As you walk-in, you'll need to go to the counter to place your order. The menu is listed on the wall and you can also view a paper menu as you walk up to the counter.  I ended up ordering a hot chocolate and my boyfriend ordered a fettucine alfredo dish. We sat outside, on a summer day, in the Vegas heat.  The hot chocolate was custom made. It wasn't listed on their menu but they offered to make me one, which is super nice of MTO Cafe!! Thank you!!   The Alfredo dish was super yummy, the bite that I had from my boyfriends meal. It was different than what I am used to as it had a variety of vegetables included in the dish. The sauce wasn't thick, but more of a lightly tossed sauce in the pasta. It was really good and I would order this meal for myself next time.  MTO Cafe is a super cute and relaxing cafe. The service was superb! It is a little bit on the pricier side, but worth it for the food quality and customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XjKSII0rvSJa3kn4giEMVQ.text: I stumbled into MTO when I was with someone who was taking soooooo long while shopping at the mall.  I had my laptop and my stomach with me, so I decided I'd grab a quick lunch and clean up my email give this spot had free WiFi.   I was pleasantly surprised by the seasonal watermelon and feta salad I gobbled right and and it was all that much better seating on a comfortable padded bench/couch.   The salad was a bit small (and a bit pricey especially given the size), so I ended up ordering a side of sweet potato fries after I finished my salad. They were so good that I didn't even mine spending more money at this cafe!  They have a really nice outdoor seating area. I wasn't able to use it though, as I visited this place in the height of Vegas summer. But, when I visit again in cooler weather, you will likely find me seating outside.  So, to sum up, this place is a really decent cafe fast food spot and a comfortable place to get caught up on work while you're waiting for someone to take forever shopping at the mall...  I will definitely be back. Minus 1 star because the food is a little overpriced. But that won't stop me from returning.  Take it from this UNLV professor, A-

But my bf order the MTO special.  The bread was burned, the spam was burned and flipped on the other side, and the bacon was burned and couldn't eat it. Asked them to redo it, and they did, but then the second come around for the redone meats were bad also. The meat was so hard, very difficult to eat, and  partially burned.

k1QlL9yCz5R8eKLqIdqupQ.text: This was my 1st time at MTO and it was just okay. I like the concept of ordering your meal then getting it delivered to your table. I ordered the BLTAE with a salad but without the A-avocado. The egg enhanced the meal however, it could been cooked a bit more and the meal was just warm not hot. As I began eating it open faced I did enjoy the pesto sauce on it. The salad dressing was a balsamic vinaigrette but was a bit sweet for me. The service at the register was nice and he had patience because again my 1st time there and I didn't know what I wanted. Overall, I'll give this place one more try.

gmhX8QZqDvI8wAZ-1qIHMA.text: Not good. They pitch that they serve healthy and fresh food. I found my Chicken Teriyaki bowl to be terrible. EWLy36EylG1M7eKicIjA3w.text: The food here is a little pricey, but very good, fresh and made to order.    When you walk in, head to the counter to place your order and pay. Then find a seat and they will bring your food to you. Very friendly staff.   I ordered the avocado toast with tomato. It was one slice but just the perfect amount! Super fresh and very tasty. I would definitely order this again! The person I was with got the waffle. It looked great and they said it was very good.

Mvwc1UQOtBs0BtUoxV-DDQ.text: I must update my review. After avoiding this place for a while because of my previous bad experience here, finally decided to give it another try.  Service has gotten way better! The servers were actually attentive and friendly. Got our food in a decent time and the vegan pancakes were great and the rest of the food was pretty good too. Left the place feeling much better, and I do intend on returning.

hyj1e36TlJbpZKgqWdkbVw.text: I don't like to write one star reviews, but the breakfast my husband and I had after the Saturday farmer's market was downright bad. And pricey, too. I ordered the steak breakfast tacos. The server asked how I wanted my steak (medium rare) which was an absolute joke because the steak on the breakfast tacos was the opposite of medium rare. More like overcooked - as were the scrambled eggs,  which were brown all over. The corn tortillas fell apart and the whole mess was tasteless and inedible. No amount of hot sauce could fix that mess. My husband ordered chicken and waffles, which is supposed to have fried chicken. This arrived with pieces of chicken doused in a gravy with a weird cinnamon flavoring, which was an awful combination with the chicken. The waffles were okay but the gravy was overkill. We won't be spending our money here, for anything other than a cup of coffee. There are far better breakfast options in Summerlin (in fact, go across the street to the Red Rock Casino for a fantastic, reasonably priced breakfast at the Grand Cafe).

cY7htdQQl670aDW51JKTwg.text: Ordered the Fat Elvis (French toast with nutella, peanut butter, bacon, bananas, and strawberries in the middle with a side of maple syrup and topped with powdered sugar). It was smaller than I imagined when looking at the pictures. The ratio of nutella to peanut butter was not my favorite. I was hoping for more nutella but the peanut butter flavor overpowered the whole sandwich. It was still good (I don't think it's possible to mess up this combo).  Friend got the B.L.T.A.E. with a side of fries which was delicious. That runny egg was perfect.  Overall good experience and service was great. We weren't able to finish all the food and brought it back as leftovers.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. B.L.T.A.E. with fries

3wnhWa9c-kX-z_vO8LtoUg.text: The food is really good prices are a little high. I got the Bob sandwich w fries for $11. If you change the fries to fruit is another $2.50! I normally don't like chicken breast but this one was really moist and tender. I subbed out honey mustard for pesto. The fries were really crispy and stayed that easy till the end. They give you a generous size of fries.  My friend got the vegan carrot pancakes and those are so good!! Better than i expected. Nice little crunch from the carrot and pecans, sweet from agave. If you have a sweet tooth get this dish! $11 for those also.  It can get a little busy here during lunch. But there's plenty of seating inside and outside. Dog friendly patio.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bob. Subbed pesto for mustard. Huge portion of fries. Very good but pricey. I think $11? In the back, avo toast, vegan pancakes.

DKe6PsIOfEYxDA479fxQag.text: Great location, employees are very friendly and do a great job. Food quality does not match the inflated price. Will not be back for a while.

_PBxqQ65dYW2A2e2B5Q3eA.text: MTO has my yelp love! I love the vibe of this cafe- the brightness of the cafe with natural light flooding through, the food and beverage choices as well as the shaded outdoor seating.   MTO sereves a very nice breakfast/ brunch before the stores open on a Sunday morning. So it is a great place to fuel up and/ or relax before getting a bit of shopping done. My favorite spot has been sitting outside on the patio watching the day begin in Downtown Summerlin.  The food is very good especially for the time of day that I come here which is breakfast/ brunch time.  The menu items have natural and a higher quality ingredients, which makes for a perfect start of the day. A couple of my favorites have been The California chicken sandwich and the Avocado Toasts. The Californian is truly a great sandwich- everything tastes fresh and non-greasy although there is bacon inside! The Avocado toast is also a great beginning at under $5! There are other wonderful menu options that I am excited to come back and try.  The people who work at MTO are so sweet and adorable. Everyone is friendly and they make sure that you have everything you need. Even my 22 year old daughter has fallen in love with this place, which says a lot because she is picker than I am!  See you soon MTO! xoxo

Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg and sausage breakfast sandwich

Nan_YSIZ4nyB_cgUehOpQw.text: So I will start with the pros. FOOD!!!! PORTIONS!!!! That's it! The food and the amount they give you is so great! This is a very fast paced place. You stand in line order all your food , get all your silverware etc. and then you sit down with your number and they will bring your food . Unless you sit outside, enjoy them yelling hello to every customer that walks in, the sound of the blenders, and the loud music etc. while your trying to enjoy your meal.  Their menu has a great variety  of items and even their kids meal is like an adult size meal. This place is great if you are just wanting a quality breakfast and are busy shopping at Downtown summerlin.

rkSouHVcLX_DshmWJBK65A.text: I'm sorry for the 2 stars because the food was phenomenal! But unfortunately while I was waiting for my food the girl (Heart Tattoo with you in it) waiting for my food and plating it. Literally picked her nose for over a minute, ran her hands through her hair, stocked silverware, put chap stick on her lips, sprayed mouthwash in her mouth and checked her phone. NEVER washing her hands. I'm definitely not picky or a clean freak but with an open concept such as yours, it's imperative that your staff be conscious of themselves.

_VbkTedOphDsGSA4PQP73Q.text: Be aware that if you have severe allergies or have a child with severe allergies, there is no food allergy disclosure at this restaurant! My son has a severe allergy (anaphylactic) to tree nuts. Their mama's ham and cheese seems innocent enough, but the honey mustard is a "pecan honey mustard". Management and store owners, please have some accountability to your consumers and inform us so we can make appropriate choices. Epi pens and ERs are not a lifestyle choice! Noone wants to spend the rest of their day worried sick about a loved one sitting in the emergency room! Life threatening food allergies are not something people choose to have, but we can certainly choose to bring our business elsewhere! Do better, be better!

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This mustard contains nuts! Be aware!

R7wQxK7r_4g-gO1JIYj53w.text: Bottom line first:  good food, oppressive music, decent value  We got here by accident--I was aiming for the one in downtown Vegas, not downtown Summerlin.  By the time I realized this, we were essentially there, and it was not worth the effort to get to the sister restaurant.   The setup was a little wonky. The entrance to the line was a little odd for me, but the more disturbing issue was how loud the music was. The selection wasn't bad, but sometime it felt like I was in a club and had to yell across the table in order to be heard.   As for the food, the tree hugger salad was pretty good. The two quinoa patties were very hearty, and the accompanying salad was also tasty. I didn't get the KFC as I had planned in order to stay a little healthier, but I'm certain I will get that next time, whichever MTO I end up in.   4 items totaling $55+ prevented this from being an excellent value, but it certainly didn't break the bank. I'll stop in again if I'm in the area next time, and hopefully the music volume will be normalized by then.

UVXDNjdsenH-lqM-xoQthQ.text: I just can't get enough of their salads. The tree hugger was a stomach-opening experience with the delicious quinoa cakes. And their almond apple salad is also legit.   Coffee is an A OK. Make sure to request the aioli on the aide for the Treehugger so it isn't doused in sauce.

YojdorQaVT3170MQbZ784Q.text: Used to love eating here. That said I had only ordered one thing - veggie hash. Maybe it's their easiest thing. This weekend I ordered the steak and eggs. Excited I could get so much to eat and probably take half home. Ordered steak medium and eggs over medium specifically said "not runny"   It came out in the most un-appetizing lazy pile of grease and runny egg goo. I could hardly tell the difference between what was butter and what was yolk. Sent back and second time eggs were just as gross and they argued with me about what "over medium" means. I literally said "this is gross" it was. I ate some steak (ok wouldn't order again) the hash browns tasted weird and I slid the eggs into a Togo box to cook at home. But it was literally so gross I can't bring myself to even re cook this stuff I have steak left too.   I ate all of the toast. So basically I had $20 of toast and they only have grape jelly.   Went to store and bought my own eggs today and they were great...  Mto should know how to cook an egg. Clearly it was done on high heat in a vat of butter or oil. Only runny eggs can be done that way without burning or slithery grossness and I'm not easily weirder out by eggs. It was weird. I wanted nothing to do with this and I was starving after hardly eating for 24 hours...

P2cKXZNnrVdOB6Zfi7c0mw.text: The food and atmosphere were really good at MTO, but I won't go back. The prices were far too high. MTO is basically a fast food joint that has healthy, fresh food. Yes, they bring your order to your table after you order at the counter and they clean the table when you leave (like Smashburger and Carl's, Jr.). I ordered vegan falafel, upgraded my fries to sweet potato fries, and purchased a drink from the soda fountain. My bill came to $17!  There are many great fast food restaurants in the same area that offer equally healthful food at much lower prices.

XVGhBeIEWzLRrJC8Tcmhgw.text: Decided to try somewhere new on my day off while walking around Downtown Summerlin. MTO cafe was perfect! Fun, friendly atmosphere.  Food was fresh and cooked to order. I had the Avocado Egg Skillet which is a scramble of eggs, red onion, jalapeno jack cheese & tomatillo sauce, topped with fresh avocado. It's what's under the scramble that makes it so yummy....a nest of their signature potatoes.  They are thinly sliced shoestring type and cooked to perfection! It's all served in a hot cast iron skillet so the dish stays warm while you are enjoying it! Nothing worse to me than cold scrambled eggs. My meal was at noon and I love that I could order eggs.... Because sometimes A girl just wants breakfast for lunch!  I'll be back to try out the rest of the menu!

aYPdPmfMNg4TQUzASle__Q.text: This was our first visit due to a voucher we purchased on the Radio show. I asked about a Gluten free menu. I was surprised that there isn't one. I ordered the chicken salad bowl but the cashier profusely apologized for ringing up the quinoa salad when he brought the food out. I kept it because it was going to be my second choice. He even brought me the other dressing to try. It was delicious and healthy with lots of arugula and cukes. The hubby ate the BLTAE sandwich which was highly recommended on Yelp. He said it was one of the best sandwiches he ever ate. Eating outdoors on the patio in the sunshine was an added bonus. We will definitely be back.

DYaes1fp9WGkusF7QrwzTw.text: Last night we went to the MTO cafe in downtown Summerlin and sad to say that will be our only visit. The menu looks interesting on line and even sounds good but this was by far the blandest food I and my mom have ever had. It's as if the cook didn't realize you do need to use some sort of salt on the food to make it tasty.  My mom got the bob chicken sandwich and for 12 bucks they really need to rethink serving it on just regular old wheat bread. Mom said it was just "okay" but would not get it again IF we came back.   I had the hangover burger which is supposed to be an 8 ounce triple angus burger with bacon,fried egg,cheddar cheese and special sauce. This burger lacked any flavor at all. It was smaller the the bun it was on,the bacon was over cooked ,the "cheddar cheese" not sure if it was on the burger or not.  The fried egg was cooked correctly but again someone needs to tell the cook salt and pepper are okay to add when cooking. In fact I wonder if the burger was even angus because it was bland and sad looking in color. At 14 bucks I expect much more.  I could have gone to McDonald's for the third of the price and had a better meal.  The young man working as cashier,server and general cleaning person for the place wasn't overly friendly but he wasn't rude either. He did however leave our food sit in the window while he wiped down the coke machine and the counters.   I wouldn't recommend wasting your money here especially with the amount of restaurants in downtown Summerlin I am sure there are better options.

Now I don't know where you come from but a breakfast skillet that I am used to is totally full with eggs, meat & potatoes. 7t1UbaEiG24O1uhJe5qa8A.text: After sampling a Hangover Burger at the Redline Rendezvous YEE, I looked forward to going to the new MTO Cafe to try more of its offerings at the source.  So, Diane and I met another couple there to do just that.  At first I was put off a bit by the spartan interior, lack of any other customers at the time, and that there was no waiter service.  For some reason, I had it in my head that the MTO Cafe would be much like the Sahara's old bustling full-service Nascar Cafe, and be a haven for comfort food.  I was right on the second supposition, but in error on the first.  And, I was slightly embarrassed that I had recommended such a casual, seemingly fast food eatery as a place to sit down to dinner with friends.  But once the food arrived, and I gazed at and initially tasted my BLTAE, my concerns were quickly dispelled.  My friends were pleased with their food: a Black & Blue Burger with French Fries, and a Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Tomato Soup, as was I.  Only Diane lamented that her Hangover Burger was not medium rare as requested.  Yet this place is decidedly not a fast food joint.  Some very good creative cooking occurs here.  I had almost instructed the order taker to hold the egg, but thought it would be more sporting and adventurous to try a BLTAE just as is was intended to be served.  This turned out to be a wise decision, for the oozing egg yolks from two quite large and perfectly prepared Sunnyside Up Fried Eggs lubricated and added flavor to the large sammie, which I had to figure out how best to eat.  I was initially torn between cutting through one-half of the heaping and rather messy sandwich with a knife and then eating it with a fork or wrestling with it by hand, before just picking it up with one hand the normal way and directing it at my mouth.  But to get my mouth around this imposing specimen on a plate took some doing.  Yet after opening my mouth like a gaping upraised garage door, sliding the loaded and egg yolk-drenched bread slices inside, and then chomping down on the strips of crispy bacon, I was in comfort food heaven, and knew that this sandwich could be eaten in the conventional manner.  Slices of red tomatoes and shards of lettuce, large chunks of very fresh avocado, and a generous heaping of excellent crisp matchstick Fries added to the enjoyment of my meal, along with a multi-variety Coke dispenser with unlimited refills.   In rating a restaurant, In my book the quality and taste of food are of paramount importance.  And, although the ambiance here was somewhat stark and resembled a school cafeteria, the place was clean, and restaurant staffers were friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  I expect to be back!

wRFN4tIrwvc7bX5nTkyV0A.text: Cute place that was fairly busy for breakfast at 10. Friendly staff. Food was a little slow on coming and forgot to bring our smoothies we ordered. Poppy seed pancakes were good and was a generous serving

vHmKspUPypfTdMcjrhtvrA.text: Greasy, soggy, cold, overpriced mess.   Ordered via UberEATS and it was a complete waste of money.   Buffalo chicken club - greasy, soggy, breading on the chicken is complete mush. Burnt buns slathered with unnecessary butter. Strips of bacon that taste like old processed bacon bits.  Fries - completely cold, hard as rocks, and obviously not fresh   Apple Rings - no crispy texture at all, dough falling off of rings. Again - complete mush.   No flavor. Just garbage.   $25 + for this horrible meal. Don't order from here unless it's a salad  I've spoken to a manager twice in regards to getting a refund. (A few minutes after receiving my order and again yesterday when I noticed that the promised refund hadn't been issued.) During my initial call I was told "Yea, our food does turn to mush if it isn't eaten within a certain timeframe & it took your UberEATS driver 40 mins to arrive." Um...ok how about you inform your drivers of the mush problem? Jeez. He then told me "I will contact UberEATS and have them issue a refund. You won't have to do anything else."  Fast forward to yesterday and there is still no refund. I call again and speak to Leland. He asks for my name and phone number and tells me that UberEATS will be calling me in regards to my refund. No call.   So at this point I'm done. The food isn't stellar to begin with but charging over $25 for 3 items that were inedible, acknowledging the problem, & then lying about attempting to remedy the situation just ensures that I, nor anyone I know, will do business with MTO Cafe ever again.

kEYSfB43jSibNM02PSWksQ.text: So I went back with a friend who knows how to order here.  It was so tasty & lots of food.   A completely different experience than I had last time although my friend says the other location is waaaay better.   My friend says eggs are organic. Did not hear that from the staff do please double check.  The hash browns are their signature potatoes & they were unusual & unexpected. It seems like they are hash brown potatoes wrapped around mashed potatoes.  Very unusual. I had to kind of taste it a few time. I Liked It. Very different, try them.   The eggs were absolutely perfectly cooked! Over medium & they were exactly that.   The meats on my special were assorted. I am not a spam fan so that went to waste.   I wish they had an option for the bread. I skipped it as did my friends. So we paid for it & got no other choice. I think this could be improved on.   The bacon was crispy & tasted great.   I got some kind of a chocolate or carib drink that was very good.    It is a menu that could be better understood with photos. For a new person like me, it is off putting.  I hope they add a photo menu or iPad or screen or something to help new people order.   Sitting outside, it was extremely pleasant.   Definitely recommend.

Ugh,sorry not acceptable, please replace them with hashbrown..then she just walks away I say I don't want them she said it's ok you can keep them, she walks away and I grab a knife and I have to wipe them off my plate into the garbage. Replace means take my plate you moron and replace them. She then brings me out the hash browns totally disgusting overly cooked and nasty greasy taste. I asked for the burger medium well..it came out medium rare and the meat made me want to hurl. All this abuse for 18 dollars. You know what I'm getting sick of shitty crappy over priced garbage and stupid young ditzy kids serving it. This place is a big fat zero. Stop overcharging for horrible food and service,it's bs.

zk6LEwAXXN0E_piAtiVxSw.text: Food was good. Service was just so slow as to be laughable. 30 mins wait for our meals when there were about 2 other tables with people in the entire restaurant? There was also a mishap with a bird pooping on our toast. Replacement toast took 15 mins- because of course that is what it takes to toast bread. Disappointing.

boNGcW89UuFgLfiIxUPYyQ.text: They need to do less and do it better. All dishes we had were underwhelming and short on flavor. Portion sizes are too large (half is enough). Need better consistency. Ordered medium steak and received it very well done. Good try, poor execution.

Uq8DEXSos375y7BMRcfvVA.text: Don't get this 3 star review twisted. I really like this place. The food is very tasty, the staff is always friendly and this location has a cute outdoor patio. I would give this place a solid 4 stars if it wasn't for the prices.   Now I'm not one to complain about the cost of stuff. If it's good, I will justify it. But keep in mind this is a quick service place. Order at the counter, get your own soda and they bring your food out to you. So when I see $7 for a cup of tomato soup, Nope, that's where I draw my line.   My spinach salad was so awesome but without chicken ($3 extra) it would have been a little boring simply because it would have only been 3 ingredients- spinach, quinoa and tomatoes. My honey got the tri-tip breakfast plate and the meat was rare (not even warm it was cooked so quick). So we brought it back up and the quickly fixed it but the flavor was just very beefy (not in a good way). The rest of the plate was delicious but he wouldn't order it again. Said he'd go back to the protein plate instead.   Overall, yummy and quick but it hits your pocket just a little too hard. Which makes MTO more of an occasional lunch stop instead of a regular one.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs. Not the best thing on the menu.
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Salad with added chicken

rfHvrgAXbr4KU7oAA0s6YQ.text: I have eaten here three or four times and the service is consistently slow but the food is worth it. The grilled cheese sandwiches are terrific and the fries are perfection. Overall worth the wait.

TuA1AmgJZx77TLDjOgl1dA.text: I came here for an afternoon snack while strolling summerlin. It's a clean cafe, however, doesn't give any impression from the outside. But as they always say, "don't judge the book by its cover". That's what I did and nothing did change.  I ordered a chicken falafel. The falafel itself is pretty big and could be shared. However, it tasted nothing special. Sad to say, it's too commercialized. I ordered some fries too, which is pretty crispy and good.....You can't go wrong with fries anyway!!  I believe they have a special drink every now and then. I'm not quite sure how often they change or have that. But that day, I had Mango Lemonade, which is sweet and refreshing. However, it also tasted like as if it came from just the concentrates.   Price is not so bad. I wouldn't come here if you can still wait to find a better place to eat and explore.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lemonade for a hot day in Vegas

d9KIUEAo1FPeEPHtFryLqg.text: Was hungry during lunch hours so why not brunch right? Passed this place numerous times located in Downtown Summerlin, me and wifey decided to go check it out. The minute me and wifey walked in we were greeted loudly "welcome to MTO Cafe!"  I waited impatiently in line for about 7 minutes before I could order which I think was a bit long, there were only two in front of me. I ordered the Turkey Melt along with their New England clam chowder, with a cup for water. I paid via their tablet system with a credit card, using my finger to sign. The cashier gave me a number to place on my table so they would know where to bring the food.   This place is unique in that other then the staff bringing your food you do all the work. From getting the utensils and napkins to even getting the condiments up front by the register. I honestly don't mind this approach as 1 it's less to worry about them screwing something up and 2 there is not spot to tip on the bill! Only a tip jar. They must pay their employees handsomely.   The ambience seemed busy as it was crowded but definitely welcoming with its random art and warm color tones. They even have USB ports by their seats in case you need to charge up. The Clam Chowder was awesome, had bacon bits in it, which they told me about beforehand. The turkey melt was equally amazing, although I feel they skimped on the cheese, also not to crazy about stringy fries but that's just a personal preference.   So aside from the wait, stringy fries, and lack of enough cheese in my sandwich I'd say for sure we'll be coming back again as my complaints aren't that dire.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nifty USB ports
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Melt
Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder with bacon bits.

uHFHeQzIG8btIVIrt2b6_w.text: If your at the mall shopping this is a nice fresh alternative to mall food! This is a cute little spot. It's super clean with a friendly staff and the food is really fresh! Loved my falafel wrap. They serve their full menu all day. So if you want breakfast for dinner you can have it! Their omelets looked amazing as the table next to us had them. We opted for the skillet version of eggs and it was yummy! Would definitely go back if we are in the neighborhood!

Had to wait for the order while the food brought to us is getting cold. Very disappointed. Two cookies don't make up for bad service.

daopP52fvZ4Dz1p8IaQNRg.text: Yummy comfort food. The deconstructed chicken pot pie is awesome, wonderful gravy that soaks into the biscuits. The grilled brie cheese sandwhich is creative and perfect for a sweet tooth.   Only downside is parking sucks.

Ga927BZ0Hbfov1-jPBaBKg.text: This is a casual place where you can get a quick breakfast or lunch. I've heard good things about this place and decided to give it a try.   Food:  1.Hangover burger (3/5): it was bland and burger was bit dry. Only delicious factor was the bacon.   2.Chicken in a waffle(2/5): chicken was tasty but waffle was so soggy.  Overall, food was not the best but their bacon is quite delicious so I might come back and just get bacon and eggs.

qlpPZktvdvx4ssGTgzHWPQ.text: Chicken in a Waffle ($13): Country gravy and fries. Great waffles and delicious fried chicken strips.  Hen House ($11): Wrap w/ lettuce, organic chicken, roasted tomato, avocado, Caesar dressing, tomato-basil tortilla, and fries.  The Bob ($12): Sandwich w/ organic chicken, arugula, roasted tomato, jack and cheddar, pecan honey mustard, grilled wheat bread, and fries.  Everything I've had is delicious and hearty without being heavy. The ingredients are fresh and the portions are perfect. It's good food that isn't too healthy (love my fries!) for an easy and fulfilling lunch. When the weather is nice, the patio is beautiful to dine.

OwWV5327oolJgbA3_Nh8yg.text: I WANT to love MTO. But they're inconsistent and their take-out food looks sad!  When dining in, it's delicious and usually fresh and the presentation is decent. When picking up and eating 5 minutes later, the salads are pathetic and contain half as much food (so why am I paying the same price??). And the fries are limp and soggy. Is there a way to keep them crispy?    I also wish they had gluten free options, not just "a sandwich with a lettuce wrap" or soup, but a gluten free wrap or something more!!!    MTO could do better

xMYaxwfCaRWn4viZ-83OjA.text: My man loves this place, and told me I had to try it.  we went for brunch and then place is beautifully decorated, located in downtown summerlin.  it's cafeteria style where you order at a counter and they serve you.    we both got the chicken in a waffle.  presentation stunning... it is waffles with a chicken fried chicken breast in the middle with white country gravy on top.   it looked so good I couldn't wait to eat it.  sadly I was a little disappointed.... it needed seasoning BAD.  For the price you pay for this, and the long drive from green valley, I really wanted to love this place.  I believe sometimes restaurants cam have bad days where seasoning is a little under, so maybe it was just that.  I may give them another try since all their food looks so beautiful.  cross my fingers

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken in a waffle, with special hashbrowns.  Gorgeous plate of food, that needs seasoning though.

UMbpRfn0JGkKaW73a4yn2Q.text: I heard so much good stuff about MTO's downtown location. I don't know how this location compares, but I'm thinking that downtown must be better. The food is mediocre I ordered a Ceaser salad today the croutons were bomb the dressing had the consistency and taste of Helmans mayo, and it seems they used a low grade parmesian cheese.   The atmosphere is great and I like thy E outdoor area music inside could be turned down a bit. Probably won't come back too many other new places to explore here in DT.

uR1VcyLqTVNPTeSE2m5QOA.text: You walk in, stand in line, order, pay on a tablet and you get hit with a page that asks for a tip. What happened to tipping after you got the service?  Then you get you're own drink, napkins, utensils, condiments...  they should tip the customer.  If you decide to use the restroom, men go in the door with a "sausage" image and women go to the door with an "egg" image (not funny) (really tacky - all the way around).  Food is nothing to write home about.

NoRqbEa5uqM3Wtdtwa--qw.text: My order was really late.  They said their online went down.  Took my payment but did not get the food going for over an hour.  Very disorganized

zPRukQ3Y7Xq-hpvwiJAXAw.text: The service is very bad and all the waitress's where fighting. It just seemed like an off day for all of them. I got the 5 cheese Mac and cheese and couldn't even finish 5 bites of it. My mom took one bite and almost spit it out. It had SO much blue cheese in it it was inedible and I am a huge blue cheese fan so that's A LOT. I got so sick from just that small amount I ate. I really wanted it to be good but it just wasn't.

hgjchWDAmm6w28lX1HLhfA.text: I have 12 check ins here. I want to like MTO so badly, but I am done. No wifi for guests, no Verizon signal in the restaurant. No decaf coffee. Staff doesn't care.  Lots of other options for great food in Las Vegas.

_o1ZLwz6NQWrEZPfBREEsA.text: MTO Cafe is the perfect place for lunch at downtown summerlin. If you're tired of local chain restaurants, MTO Cafe is the place since the original one is in downtown LV! I got the BLTAE sandwich and it is truly a MEAL. It tasted amazing. I ate here at 3 pm and was super full with the sandwich! In the BLTAE, the avocado was super fresh. The French fries were also really good! I finished the entire BLTAE and felt accomplished afterwards.

IDz_z8Q7OxMcgV028FAAyw.text: This is one of those places where you can get food and feel healthy about it.  Typically these kind of places aren't cheap.    I got the smoked salmon skillet and was disappointed.  The salmon was red and super salty.  I like salty, but I felt like I was just eating salt.  Comes with cream cheese, dill, eggs, and hash browns.  I like my salmon orange and marbleized, so I'm not sure why this salmon is red.  Was it some sort of dye to preserve the salmon to keep it fresh?    Maybe I'll give MTO another shot and try something else, but the smoked salmon...never again.

on5_EjIsWvGH7lv7LThxEA.text: I came to check out the new H&M store located in downtown Summerlin mall. I stumbled upon this cafe which is just right across from H&M store. I've always wanted to try this place out, but it's always busy. I went around 3PM and surprisingly there were no line. I was like wow, on a Saturday?   I went with a few others and the first thing come to mind when we saw the menu, a bit too pricy. Price ranges from $11.00 to $13.00. I just wanted something light and not too expensive, but since we already there, I figured why not just try it. I figured with that price, I'm sure it was going to be a big portion.   We ordered two lemon cilantro chicken salad ($12.00) and spicy chicken sandwich ($13.00). Both were okay, nothing different. I'm sure you can find something way less than the menu price elsewhere. Overall, atmosphere is clean, love the location, staffs were friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of MTO Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken cilantro salad and spicy chicken sandwich

oP3dK6Xv7tkVyVphYYIZsg.text: Mto is, in easy translation, el sucko.  Ordered the mac 'n cheese. They claim it's 4 cheese; sure 97% Velveeta and 1% each of 3 other  cheeses, but it still tastes like Velveeta, with a hint (small hint) of blue. Would not order again. My wife ordered a hamburger, listed for $9.95. It rung up as $10.95 and included a bun with fries, nothing else. We asked about lettuce and tomato and that was 2 bucks more. To add cheese, another buck.  Hello, I can go to Gordon Ramsey's Pub at Caesar's and get his burger for that. Thumbs down.

KH7GrH7THPcwmsUd2JPGcg.text: Delicious breakfast and hamburgers. Family friendly and perfect area to walk around and shop with a full stomach. Prices are very fair, highly recommend!

X2z0oS1vv6jt3fq2w0D5og.text: BLAND and overpriced. Customer service at the register was great, but the food was VERY bland. We got the chicken teriyaki bowl and the bob sandwich. The sandwich was tiny, they forgot to put avocado in our sandwich, and the salad that it came with was gross. The teriyaki bowl lacked flavor. This meal was a waste of money.

BAznEC-eXsXn_jaCiBA5qg.text: Great ambience.  Superb location.  Ok food   Is this a coffee shop or a modeling agency? Waitresses here are supermodel status, except about  a foot shorter lol  Would def come back.

slPcTeK4_C_wMTQ36-c4pw.text: Great place to grab breakfast or lunch. Never had a bad meal or  bad service. The soda machine seems to ALWAYS be out of something. Yesterday it was root beer and Dr. Pepper.

I got the Turkey Melt Sandwich & shared it with my 3 & 1 year old! They don't eat much but it was plenty of food! Their fries, ranch and chipotle sauce are "bomb" according to my 3 year old. Lol

I was a little upset bc the sandwich was cold so I sent it back.  They brought out a fresh one and it was very delicious.  I was already satisfied at this point.  Then someone...maybe manager? Came to the table with a refund for the sandwich and three warm cookies!  Kudos to MTO for amazing customer service.  We are definitely not customers who generally complain or look for a refund.  Will return for sure!

eMUOlwJlLU4D5430IlCzYw.text: Usually a good experience but today was one of the worst I have ever had at a restaurant. First, they only had one person working the register while 6 people randomly acted busy behind him. The line built up and took forever while the 6 other staff did menial tasks like put ice cubes in the sink. After waiting in line for 15 minutes, they somehow lost our order. It took another 30 minutes for them to deliver any food. The help eventually came over to tell us they were going to put a rush order on our food but it still took them another 15 minutes after that. For our trouble, they offered us a free pastry, which nobody wanted. Eventually we just left and never received half of our order. Terrible experience

Well, maybe the uncomfortable aftertaste that lingered longer than I'd like to admit. The service was ho-hum, not bad, not good or great. I guess you could say that there approach is food is fuel, not fun or enjoyable. I guess you could say the options in Vegas have left me jaded and this isn't going to hold up to the competition.

jXyOoHRx_0LKbITGRmQIAA.text: It's just too overpriced for how below mediocre the quality is. Even if it was moderately priced it's still not good food in my opinion. I had a burger and would have preferred any of the basic burger places to it. It's got a good idea (business model wise) but I don't know why they think they can charge that much money for how bland their food is. I didn't like the downtown location either.
